metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1979 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the PK11_ImportDERPrivateKeyInfoAndReturnKey function in Mozilla Network Security Services (NSS) before 3.21.1, as used in Mozilla Firefox before 45.0, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact via crafted key data with DER encoding.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1979` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 45.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-globalmenu - 45.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 45.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-testsuite - 45.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

libnss3 - 2:3.21-1ubuntu3
libnss3-1d - 2:3.21-1ubuntu3
libnss3-nssdb - 2:3.21-1ubuntu3
libnss3-tools - 2:3.21-1ubuntu3
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> fix was actually in 3.21, not in 3.21.1 as mentioned
